question.title: Verify Preorder Sequence in Binary Search Tree
question.content:
You are given an array/list ‘ARR’ consisting of ‘N’ distinct integers. You need to check whether ‘ARR’ can represent the Preorder Traversal of a Binary Search Tree.

You should return true if ‘ARR’ can represent Preorder Traversal of a Binary Search Tree, otherwise return false.

Example:
Consider ‘ARR’ = [40, 30, 35, 80, 100]. You can see that it is the preorder traversal of the Binary Search Tree shown above.

Thus, we should return true in this case.
Input format:
The first line of input contains an integer ‘T’ denoting the number of test cases. then ‘T’ test cases follow.

The first line of each test case consists of a single integer ‘N’ representing the size of the list/array ‘ARR’.

The second line of each test case consists of ‘N’ single space-separated integers representing list/ array ‘ARR’.
Output format :
For each test case, print a single line containing a string ‘True’ if  ‘ARR’ can represent Preorder Traversal of a Binary Search Tree, otherwise print ‘False’.  

The output of each test case will be printed in a separate line.

Note:

You do not need to print anything, it has already been taken care of. Just implement the given function.
Constraints:
1 <= T <= 50
1 <= N <= 10 ^ 4
1 <= ARR[i] <= 10 ^ 9

Where ‘ARR[i]’ is the element of the given array ‘ARR’ at index ‘i’.   

Time limit: 1 sec.
Sample Input 1:
2
1
1
5
40 30 35 80 100
Sample Output 1:
True
True
Explanation of Sample Input 1:
Test case 1:
There is only one element is ‘ARR’, and it is the preorder traversal of a Binary Search tree having a single node with value 1.

Test case 2:
See the problem statement for an explanation.
Sample Input 2:
2
3
2 4 1
6
5 2 3 1 7 8
Sample Output 2:
False
False

rephrased.body: Given an array of distinct integers, determine if it represents the preorder traversal of a Binary Search Tree (BST). Return `true` if it does, otherwise return `false`.
constraints: ARR[i] is the element of the given array ARR at index i

testcases.explanation: The array contains only one element, which trivially represents a BST with a single node.
The array [40, 30, 35, 80, 100] represents the preorder traversal of a valid BST.
The array [2, 4, 1] does not represent a valid BST preorder traversal.
The array [5, 2, 3, 1, 7, 8] does not represent a valid BST preorder traversal.

hints: Use stack to  track the closest node for each ‘i’ for which this ‘i’th node is on the right subtree using stack
Can you optimize the space complexity of the previous approach (based on the stack)?
